body_html:
I see. This is a problem with how we name the images.

The .ipynb --> .md converter names the image files after the cell index.
And there's lag between updating english versions, and any other languages.

So if the cell number changes and we republish the image, it moves and breaks the other languages.

A better solution will be to use the cell['metadata']['id'] for the image paths, then they will be somewhat more robust.
body_text:
I see. This is a problem with how we name the images.
The .ipynb --> .md converter names the image files after the cell index.
And there's lag between updating english versions, and any other languages.
So if the cell number changes and we republish the image, it moves and breaks the other languages.
A better solution will be to use the cell['metadata']['id'] for the image paths, then they will be somewhat more robust.
body:
I see. This is a problem with how we name the images.

The .ipynb --> .md converter names the image files after the cell index.
And there's lag between updating english versions, and any other languages.

So if the cell number changes and we republish the image, it moves and breaks the other languages.

A better solution will be to use the cell['metadata']['id'] for the image paths, then they will be somewhat more robust.
